repnme.cdata!: Haiti - Emergency Economic Recovery Credit Project

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Emergency Economic Recovery Credit
            (EERC) in Haiti. The objective of the EERC was to provide
            urgently needed balance of payments support to reactivate
            Haiti's economy and initiate the economic recovery
            process in the context of the overall Emergency Economic
            Recovery Program(EERP) . The project was highly successful
            in achieving its objectives. The performance of
            International Development Association (IDA) through the
            project cycle is rated highly satisfactory. The performance
            of the borrower was fully satisfactory. The key lessons
            learned from this operation were: (i) for the rapid
            preparation and successful implementation of this emergency
            recovery operation, strong government commitment and very
            close communication proved essential; (ii) judging by the
            delays in restructuring ongoing projects, which needed to
            reconcile emergency and medium-term objectives, another
            critical factor for the success of the EERC was its focus on
            most immediate needs; (iii) reconstruction itself should not
            be seen as a mechanism to achieve medium-term objectives,
            which should be addressed in follow-up operations; and (iv)
            a final major factor in this operation was flexibility and
            responsiveness by IDA in the preparation of this operation.

abstracts.cdata!:
The Economic Emergency Recovery Credit
            Project (EERC) will provide urgently needed balance of
            payments support to reactivate Haiti's economy and
            initiate the economic recovery process in the context of the
            overall Program. Specifically, the US$40 million EERC is
            designed as a quick-disbursing emergency operation which
            will finance the cost, insurance and freight (CIF) value of
            imports based on a positive list identified as necessary to
            the Program. The imports will support emergency activities
            in all sectors covered by the Program. Within the confines
            of the positive list, EERC funding will not be earmarked for
            specific sectors or activities, and will finance imports of
            consumable or capital goods by both public and private entities.
